job.forms module

class job.forms.JobForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating and updating Job postings.

Parameters:

  • title (django.forms.CharField) – The title of the job.

  • description (django.forms.CharField) – A detailed description of the job.

  • requirements (django.forms.CharField) – The requirements for the job.

  • location (django.forms.CharField) – The location of the job.

  • salary_range (django.forms.CharField) – The salary range for the job.

  • employment_type (django.forms.CharField) – The type of employment (e.g., full-time, part-time).

  • application_deadline (django.forms.DateField) – The deadline for applications.

  • is_active (django.forms.BooleanField) – Whether the job posting is active.

  • skills_required (django.forms.ModelMultipleChoiceField) – The skills required for the job.

Form fields:

  • title: Title (CharField)

  • description: Description (CharField)

  • requirements: Requirements (CharField)

  • location: Location (CharField)

  • salary_range: Salary range (CharField)

  • employment_type: Employment type (CharField)

  • application_deadline: Application deadline (DateField)

  • is_active: Is Active (BooleanField)

  • skills_required: Skills required (ModelMultipleChoiceField)

property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

job.models module

class job.models.Job(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseModel

Represents a job posting.

Parameters:

  • recruiter (recruiter.models.RecruiterProfile) – The recruiter who posted the job.

  • title (django.db.models.CharField) – The title of the job.

  • description (django.db.models.TextField) – A detailed description of the job.

  • requirements (django.db.models.TextField) – The requirements for the job.

  • location (django.db.models.CharField) – The location of the job.

  • salary_range (django.db.models.CharField) – The salary range for the job.

  • employment_type (django.db.models.CharField) – The type of employment (e.g., full-time, part-time).

  • posted_date (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – The date when the job was posted.

  • application_deadline (django.db.models.DateField) – The deadline for applications.

  • is_active (django.db.models.BooleanField) – Whether the job posting is active.

  • skills_required (django.db.models.ManyToManyField) – The skills required for the job.

  • id (BigAutoField) – Primary key: ID

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – Created at

  • updated_at (DateTimeField) – Updated at

Reverse relationships:

Parameters:

applications (Reverse ForeignKey from Application) – All applications of this job (related name of job)

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

application_deadline

Type: DateField

Application deadline

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this

applications

Type: Reverse ForeignKey from Application

All applications of this job (related name of job)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager

Recruiter (related name: jobs)

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

class Child(Model):

skills_required

Type: ManyToManyField to Skill

Skills required (related name: required_in_jobs)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager

class job.views.RecruiterRequiredMixin

Bases: LoginRequiredMixin, UserPassesTestMixin

Mixin to restrict access to views only to recruiters.

handle_no_permission()

Handles the case where the user does not have permission to access the view.

test_func()

Checks if the current user is a recruiter.

Returns:

True if the user is a recruiter, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
